page.title: 12Warbleton & Buxted Band
page.content: The brass band was formed in l896. Recently membership has been falling though there are still l9 players including 4 juniors and 7 females. Advertisements have been made for more players without success but it is hoped to introduce young people and teach them from scratch. Rehearsals take place twice a week at the Dunn village Hall. There is no full time band master at present and the conducting has been undertaken by three people - Mrs Beryl Unsted,Mr Keith Buss & his son Martin Buss. This is a family tradition for the Buss family have provided three previous bandmasters. During the summer season music was provided at several local fetes & also at the Festival of Remembrance at the White Rock Theatre Hastings.Carols will be played in local villages & at Warbleton Church.
